alfredsnippet.snippet:
(cont'd)

"... It would be necessary to create a separate body.  One possible name would be the National Discovery Center. The center would be governed by a board representing a wide range of interests, including nongovernmental organizations, schools and voluntary associations.  Individuals could send suggestions in over the Internet.  Local and national organizations could lobby for projects.  Potential subjects for research could be discussed in the news media. This new venture would make science more attractive to young people, stimulate interest in scientific thinking and hypothesis-testing, and help break down the depressing alienation many people feel from science."

- Really Popular Science, Rupert Sheldrake, New York Times January 4th 2003
